description: Ready-to-use combat encounters across various Skyrim settings with stat blocks, tactics, and environmental features.

difficulty_scale.very_hard: Extremely dangerous, party may need to retreat or get creative
difficulty_scale.legendary: Epic boss fight, full party resources required

bandit_marauder.tactics: Ambush from cover, focus on isolated targets, flee if taking heavy casualties

bandit_chief.tactics: Commands bandits, targets spellcasters first, fights to the death for loot

terrain.aspects: Create 'Ambush Position' or 'Treacherous Footing' as situation aspects

variations.archer_focus: Replace 2 marauders with archers (Good Shoot, Fair Fight)
variations.mage_support: Add bandit hedge mage with basic destruction spells

wilderness_encounters.name: Wolf Pack

wolf.special: Pack Tactics: +1 to Fight when adjacent to another wolf
wolf.tactics: Surround prey, attack weakest target, flee if alpha is killed

alpha_wolf.special: Alpha Howl: Once per scene, all wolves gain +2 to Fight for one exchange
alpha_wolf.tactics: Coordinates pack, focuses on wounded targets

rewards.loot: Wolf pelts (crafting material), sometimes wolf meat

wilderness_encounters.scaling: Add more wolves or ice wolves (stronger variant) for higher difficulty

wilderness_encounters.name: Troll Encounter

special.regeneration: At start of each exchange, clear 1 physical stress box (stopped if hit by fire damage)

troll.weaknesses: Fire damage prevents regeneration for one exchange, -2 to defend against fire
troll.tactics: Aggressive melee assault, regenerates unless burned, flees only when near death

terrain.hazards: Potentially knock enemies off edges with strong attacks

rewards.loot: Troll fat (alchemy), sometimes treasure from victims

wilderness_encounters.gm_notes: Trolls are dangerous early-game threats. Party should use fire or focus fire to overwhelm regeneration.

wilderness_encounters.name: Giant and Mammoth

special.giant_stomp: Weapon:4 attack, on success with style, sends target flying (move 2 zones, take 1 additional stress)
special.club_smash: Weapon:3 attack, can hit multiple targets in melee

giant.tactics: Slow but devastating attacks, usually peaceful unless provoked or camp approached
giant.size: Giants occupy 2 zones worth of space

mammoth.special: Trample: Weapon:3, can move through zone and attack all targets in path
mammoth.tactics: Defensive unless giant is attacked, then charges aggressively

rewards.loot: Giant's toe (valuable alchemy), mammoth tusk (valuable), gold, cheese wheels

wilderness_encounters.diplomacy_option: Giants are not inherently hostile. Can be avoided or even befriended in rare cases.
wilderness_encounters.warning: Giants can one-shot low-level characters. Approach with extreme caution.

special.pounce: If attacking from stealth, Weapon:3 and create 'Pinned' aspect on target
special.bleeding_bite: On successful hit, create 'Bleeding' aspect (1 stress per exchange unless treated)

sabre_cat.tactics: Stalks from stealth, pounces on isolated target, disengages if seriously wounded

draugr.special: Immune to fear, poison, and disease. Vulnerable to fire (+2 stress from fire attacks)
draugr.tactics: Mindless aggression, fight until destroyed, no self-preservation

special.frost_breath: Once per scene, exhale frost in zone (Weapon:2 to all targets, creates 'Chilled' aspect)
special.unrelenting_force_minor: Can use Fus (1-word shout) to knock back targets

draugr_wight.tactics: Uses Thu'um if available, aggressive melee combatant

terrain.traps: Pressure plates triggering darts or fire (Notice Fair +2 to spot, Overcome to disarm)

rewards.loot: Ancient Nord weapons, gold, possibly enchanted item in boss chest
rewards.special: Word Wall in deeper chambers (Thu'um learning opportunity)

variations.boss_version: Draugr Overlord or Death Lord (see legendary encounters)

dungeon_encounters.name: Falmer Patrol

special.blind_sight: Cannot see but has superb hearing. +2 to Notice sounds, -2 to Notice visual stealth
special.poisoned_weapons: Attacks create 'Poisoned' aspect (1 stress per exchange for 2 exchanges unless treated)

falmer.tactics: Relies on hearing, swarms targets, uses poison, fights in darkness

special.poison_spit: Ranged attack (Shoot Good +3), creates 'Poisoned' aspect on hit

chaurus.tactics: Spits poison from range, charges into melee, protects Falmer

terrain.hazards: Without light source, party takes -2 to all actions. Falmer unaffected.

rewards.loot: Falmer ears, chaurus chitin (crafting), Dwemer artifacts, poison samples

dungeon_encounters.stealth_option: Party can sneak past if they're very quiet (opposing Falmer's Notice+2)

dungeon_encounters.name: Necromancer and Undead

special.raise_dead: Once per scene, raise 1-2 corpses as thralls (requires corpses in area)
special.drain_life: Weapon:2 spell attack, heals necromancer for 1 stress on hit

necromancer.tactics: Stays at range, raises undead minions, drains life, flees if threatened in melee

thrall.special: Immune to fear and mental attacks. When destroyed, can be raised again by necromancer.
thrall.tactics: Swarm nearest living target, block access to necromancer

terrain.aspects: 'Desecrated Ground' or 'Corpses Everywhere' (necromancer can raise more)

rewards.loot: Soul gems, spell tomes, necromancer robes (enchanted), alchemy ingredients

dungeon_encounters.tactical_note: Focus fire on necromancer or prevent corpse raising. Undead respawn if caster lives.

dungeon_encounters.name: Dwemer Automaton Defense

special.construct_resilience: Immune to poison, disease, mental effects. Vulnerable to shock damage (+2 stress)

dwemer_sphere.tactics: Patrols ruins, activates when intruders detected, uses crossbow at range then charges with blades

special.lightning_burst: When destroyed, explodes dealing Weapon:2 shock damage to adjacent targets

dwemer_spider.tactics: Swarms targets, sacrificial attacks to trigger explosion

terrain.hazards: Steam vents can be triggered (Weapon:2 fire damage in zone)

rewards.loot: Dwemer scrap metal (valuable), Dwemer cogs and gears, soul gems from constructs

dungeon_encounters.scaling: Add Dwemer Centurion (boss-level automaton) for legendary difficulty

faction_combat_encounters.name: Imperial Patrol

imperial_soldier.special: Shield Wall: When adjacent to another soldier, both gain +1 to defend
imperial_soldier.tactics: Formations, coordinated attacks, retreat to regroup if losing badly

legate.special: Command: Once per scene, all Imperial allies gain +2 to one action type for one exchange
legate.tactics: Commands troops, focuses on party leader, negotiates if possible

faction_combat_encounters.diplomacy: If party is neutral or Imperial-aligned, can negotiate instead of fight. Hostile if party is Stormcloak.

faction_combat_encounters.name: Stormcloak Ambush

stormcloak_soldier.equipment: Nord battleaxe or sword (Weapon:2), Stormcloak armor (Armor:1)
stormcloak_soldier.special: For Skyrim!: Once per scene, battle cry gives all Stormcloaks +1 to Fight for one exchange
stormcloak_soldier.tactics: Ambush tactics, hit and run, aggressive charges, fight with passion

stormcloak_officer.special: Rally Cry: Once per scene, all allies gain +2 to attack rolls for one exchange
stormcloak_officer.tactics: Leads from front, inspires troops, targets enemies aggressively

faction_combat_encounters.diplomacy: If party is neutral or Stormcloak-aligned, can negotiate. Hostile if party is Imperial.

faction_combat_encounters.name: Thalmor Justiciar Patrol

thalmor_justiciar.equipment: Elven sword (Weapon:2), Thalmor robes (Armor:1, +1 to magic)
thalmor_justiciar.tactics: Uses magic primarily, melee as backup, orders soldiers aggressively

thalmor_soldier.tactics: Protects Justiciar, coordinated attacks, fights to the death

faction_combat_encounters.diplomacy: Thalmor are generally hostile to anyone sympathetic to Talos worship or Stormcloaks. Arrogant in negotiations.

rewards.loot: Elven equipment, Thalmor documents (intelligence value), gold

faction_combat_encounters.story_importance: Thalmor encounters tie into main conspiracy storyline. Documents can reveal plots.

legendary_boss_encounters.name: Dragon Priest

dragon_priest.equipment: Dragon Priest Staff (Weapon:3), Dragon Priest Mask (Armor:2, unique powers)

special_abilities.master_destruction: Can cast Fireball (Weapon:3, hits all in zone), Ice Storm (Weapon:3, creates 'Frozen' aspect), Lightning Storm (Weapon:4)
special_abilities.summon_undead: Once per scene, summon 2-3 Draugr or Frost Atronach
special_abilities.magical_ward: Armor: 2 vs. all attacks, +2 additional vs. magic
special_abilities.hover: Floats, immune to ground-based obstacles and attacks
special_abilities.mask_power: Each mask has unique ability (varies by priest)

dragon_priest.tactics: Stays at range, casts devastating spells, summons minions, uses staff and mask powers, extremely intelligent
dragon_priest.regeneration: Recovers 1 stress box per exchange while mask is active

rewards.loot: Dragon Priest Mask (legendary artifact with unique power), Staff, massive gold hoard, enchanted items

legendary_boss_encounters.preparation: Party should be well-prepared with potions, strategy, and full resources. This is an epic boss fight.
legendary_boss_encounters.variations: Each named Dragon Priest (Morokei, Krosis, Volsung, etc.) has different mask powers and spell preferences

legendary_boss_encounters.name: Frost Dragon

special_abilities.frost_breath: Weapon:4 attack to all in zone, creates 'Deep Freeze' aspect. Can use from air.
special_abilities.thu_um_mastery: Knows multiple shouts: Frost Breath (primary), Unrelenting Force (Fus Ro Dah), Fire Breath (if elder dragon)
special_abilities.flight: Can fly, making melee difficult. Archers and mages most effective. Can be grounded with Dragonrend shout if available.
special_abilities.bite_and_claw: Weapon:3 melee attacks when on ground
special_abilities.tail_swipe: Weapon:2 attack hitting multiple adjacent targets
special_abilities.wing_buffet: Knockback attack, pushes all adjacent enemies one zone

frost_dragon.tactics: Flies and uses breath attacks, lands occasionally for melee, uses Thu'um strategically, highly intelligent and tactical

phases.aerial: Strafing breath attacks, difficult to hit with melee
phases.grounded: Melee combat, still uses breath and Thu'um, more vulnerable

rewards.loot: Dragon scales and bones (crafting legendary armor/weapons), dragon soul (if Thu'um user), massive treasure hoard, possibly legendary artifact
rewards.special: Word Wall teaching Thu'um, reputation boost as Dragon Slayer

tactical_notes: Ranged combat essential during aerial phase
Dragonrend Thu'um (if known) forces dragon to land
Fire damage is less effective, shock is standard, frost is resisted
Dragon will flee if reduced to severe consequence and no lair to defend
legendary_boss_encounters.story_impact: Slaying a dragon is a legendary feat. NPCs treat dragon slayer with awe and respect.

legendary_boss_encounters.name: Werewolf Pack Leader

special_abilities.claw_attacks: Weapon:3, can attack twice per exchange
special_abilities.howl: Once per scene, all werewolves gain +2 to all actions for two exchanges
special_abilities.regeneration: Recover 1 physical stress box per exchange (silver weapons prevent this)
special_abilities.fear_aura: Enemies must overcome Fair (+2) Will check or take -1 to all actions

alpha_werewolf.weaknesses: Silver weapons deal +2 stress and prevent regeneration for one exchange
alpha_werewolf.tactics: Pack coordination, alpha commands, brutal melee assault, uses howl to empower pack

special.pack_tactics: +1 to Fight when adjacent to another werewolf

werewolf.tactics: Surround prey, coordinate with pack, follow alpha's lead

rewards.loot: Rare alchemy ingredients, possibly silver weapons from previous victims
rewards.special: May discover cure for lycanthropy or learn werewolf secrets

legendary_boss_encounters.moral_complexity: Werewolves may be cursed innocents, not purely evil. Party may seek cure rather than kill.

effects.cold_damage: 1 stress per two exchanges without cold protection

blizzard_combat.tactics: Favors melee fighters, Nords, and those with cold resistance

avalanche_danger.trigger: Loud sounds (Thu'um, explosions, giant stomps) may trigger avalanche
avalanche_danger.effect: All in area must overcome Great (+4) Athletics or be buried (Weapon:3, creates 'Buried in Snow' aspect)
avalanche_danger.tactics: Be careful with loud abilities, use to your advantage against enemies

common_traps: Pressure plate arrows: Notice (Fair +2) to spot, Overcome (Fair +2) to disarm, Weapon:2 if triggered
Swinging blades: Notice (Good +3) to spot, Athletics (Good +3) to avoid, Weapon:3 if hit
Flame jets: Notice (Fair +2) to spot, Overcome (Fair +2) to disable, Weapon:2 fire if triggered
Poison darts: Stealth or Notice (Fair +2), creates 'Poisoned' aspect if hit
ancient_ruins_traps.integration: Traps add danger to dungeon combats. Enemies may trigger them or force PCs into them.

using_templates: Adjust difficulty by adding/removing enemies or increasing skill levels
Use terrain and aspects to make encounters memorable
Don't just use combat - allow negotiation, stealth, or clever solutions
scaling_encounters: For higher level parties: increase enemy skills by +1-2, add more enemies, or use advanced variants
For lower level parties: reduce enemy numbers, lower skills by -1-2, or allow easier diplomacy/escape
Use consequences and stress to gauge difficulty. If party isn't using resources, increase challenge.
making_combat_interesting: Use environmental features (cliffs, fire pits, machinery)
Create situation aspects PCs can exploit
Have enemies use tactics (cover, flanking, focus fire)
Give enemies personality (taunts, fear reactions, clever strategies)
Offer alternative objectives (protect NPC, retrieve item, escape)
encounter_balance: Not every encounter should be fair - sometimes overwhelming odds or trivial fights tell story
Mix combat difficulty throughout session: easy (resource conservation), moderate (standard), hard (resource expenditure), legendary (rare, climactic)
Give PCs chance to recover between hard fights
Reward creativity - if PCs find clever solution, let it work
